intro: Thevetia ahouai, commonly known as the Madagascar yellow trumpet, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and its stems are often branched. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Thevetia ahouai is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments and is often found in open woodlands.
